qas.question: What did an established church, even at the state level, have?
What region did Isaac Backus come from?
When did Isaac Backus write against a state sanctioned religion?
When was Thomas Jefferson's Virginia Statute for Religious Freedom enacted?
What didn't an established church, even at the state level, have?
What city did Isaac Backus come from?
When did Isaac Backus write supporting a state sanctioned religion?
When was Thomas Jefferson's Virginia Statute for Religious Freedom rejected?

context: There were also <a0_0><b5_0>opponents<b5_0/><a0_0/> to the support of any established church even at the state level. In <a3_0><b6_0><b8_0>1773<b8_0/><b6_0/><a3_0/>, Isaac Backus, a prominent <a1_0>Baptist minister<a1_0/> in <a2_0><b7_0>New England<b7_0/><a2_0/>, wrote against a state sanctioned religion, saying: "Now who can hear Christ declare, that his kingdom is, not of this world, and yet believe that this blending of church and state together can be pleasing to him?" He also observed that when "church and state are separate, the effects are happy, and they do not at all interfere with each other: but where they have been confounded together, no tongue nor pen can fully describe the mischiefs that have ensued." Thomas Jefferson's influential Virginia Statute for Religious Freedom was enacted in <a4_0><b9_0>1786<b9_0/><a4_0/>, five years before the Bill of Rights.
